Content:: Off the Wall is a 1983 American crime comedy film directed by Rick Friedberg, written by Dick Chudnow, and starring Paul Sorvino, Patrick Cassidy, and Rosanna Arquette. A young woman frames two hitchhikers for her crimes. Feeling guilty, she tries to break them out. Roger Ebert of the Chicago Sun-Times gave the film 1.5 out of 4 stars, calling it "one of the most lame-brained movies of recent years."[1]  This film article about a 1980s comedy is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
